defectSimulation.smartNoise.fftFuncs.autocorr(image)¶
defectSimulation.smartNoise.fftFuncs.azimuthalAverage(image, center=None)¶

Calculate the azimuthally averaged radial profile.

image - The 2D image center - The [x,y] pixel coordinates used as the center. The default is

None, which then uses the center of the image (including fracitonal pixels).

defectSimulation.smartNoise.noiseExtractor module¶

defectSimulation.smartNoise.noiseExtractor.boxZero(image, sideLength)¶

Creates a box centred at the centre of the image.

Args: image: an image as an array or tensor sideLength (int): side length of box centred around the centre of image

Returns: image: image as array or tensor with dark box added

defectSimulation.smartNoise.noiseExtractor.extractNoise(image, boxSize)¶

Extracts noise from image from within a box.

Args: image: an image as an array or tensor boxSize (int): side length of box centred around the centre of image

Returns: noiseR: noise image as array or tensor

class defectSimulation.smartNoise.noiseExtractor.getter(ax, fig)¶

Bases: object

Needs further inspection

click(event)¶
move(event)¶
defectSimulation.smartNoise.noiseExtractor.noiseExtractor(home, noiseSamplePath, crop, cropManual, cropX, cropY)¶

Validate model on a dataset through mAP

Args: home (str): home directory of sett2 noiseSamplePath (str): path to noise sample images

Writes: noise: noise image files written to ../sett2/smartNoise/noiseSamples/noiseFiles where base is the directory containing sett2

Note: Put data image .tif files ../sett2/smartNoise/noiseSamples to extract noise

defectSimulation.smartNoise.noiseExtractor.rgb2gray(rgb)¶

Converts an rgb image tensor to tensor. Args: rgb: an image as a tensor of rgb (no alpha)

Returns: gray: image as array in grayscale

defectSimulation.smartNoise.noiseExtractor.skewImage(image, shift)¶

Skews an image to a direction.

Args: image: an image as an array or tensor shift (int): value of shift

Returns: rotated: NEEDS INVESTIGATION

defectSimulation.smartNoise.noiseExtractor.standardize(image)¶

Stadardise the average brightness and dynamic range of an image

Args: image (image): input a image as tensor to be standardised

Returns: image: Standardised image

Note: Hard-coded to output a dynamic range of 6 sigmas
